page.title: 14The River Arun-Littlehampton
page.content: The River Arun works its way cutting through the chalk rocks upon the South Downs towards the sea at Littlehampton.The Arun is a twisting,turning river and is very tidal up to Pallingham.The River Arun has cut its way through the Amberley Downs and the River flows down to the mouth at Littlehampton.The source of the river is to be found near Horsham in a place called Itchingfield. The River Arun did not always have its mouth at Littlehampton however,it used to have a lagoon that stretched eastwards towards Shoreham.Eventually the river breached the lagoon and gave the river access at Littlehampton.The river has been straightened(1735) and has been deepened so more ships and larger ships can use the river itself.
